author: potuz
content: After the merge, a user running a beacon node or an execution engine, helps the network, even if not validating. What would be preferible given that a user will run one but not both?

author: jiekai9348
content: I thought one has to run both.  It would be bundled.  Edit: Oh, running one is also helpful?

author: protolambda
content: <@!536468500513030147> shorten your message and keep it technical, this is not an advertisement server

author: protolambda
content: <@!755590043632140352> They are both important in their own ways for network health, you should run both if you run a validator. Both is always preferred really. I suppose the execution engine, if able to serve and sync on its own, is more valuable for the greater good to run (since there's lots of state to serve to other nodes).

author: sky.cactus
content: If you run an execution client and use a third party consensus client for tracking head, what is the worst that can happen to you?

author: sky.cactus
content: I guess you could get fed a fake chain?

author: sky.cactus
content: The fake chain would need to follow all execution consensus rules, but it may be a fork chain.  I guess the consensus client you talk to could also tell you that the chain is finalized (when it isn't).

author: potuz
content: Yeah and the other way around you may not gossip good attestations/blocks which would be the main help of running a node without a vc. But my guess is with proto that the eth1 client is more useful overall. Also it takes much more resources

author: sky.cactus
content: You could still be a transaction relay, though you may slowly fall out of sync and eventually get disconnected as you would broadcast invalid transactions to the network (used nonces and the like).

author: protolambda
content: Would be interesting to see a light-client node (Eth2 has good support for that after Altair upgrade) to determine the head, then you can sync an execution node without the consensus node trust assumption

author: sky.cactus
content: Light client consensus, full client execution?

author: protolambda
content: yes

author: potuz
content: And the portal network solves the problem the other way I guess

author: sky.cactus
content: An odd pairing since execution is the big one, but I like the general idea of mixing and matching light/heavy like that.

author: protolambda
content: A beacon node isn't that heavy to run compared to an exec node though

author: protolambda
content: Just netto better than trusting an external consensus API provider

author: potuz
content: Execution is the big one, but consensus is heavy on CPU at prescribed times, which may strain the execution client at those times

author: sky.cactus
content:

```
Alright:    Light | Portal

```
